name: 陳維昌
objective:
This course aims to introduce the fundamental principles of digital communication systems. The course contains the following topics:

1. Introduction
2. Deterministic and Random Signal Analysis
3. Digital Modulation Schemes 
4. Optimum Receivers for AWGN Channels 
5. An Introduction to Information Theory
6. Block and Convolutional Channel Codes 
7. Spread Spectrum Signals for Digital Communications
schedule:
Week     01: Introduction
Week     02: 228 Peace Memorial Day
Weeks 03~04: Deterministic and Random Signal Analysis
Weeks 05~06: Digital Modulation Schemes 
Week     07: Qingming Festival
Weeks 08~09: Optimum Receivers for AWGN Channels  
Week     10: Midterm Exam
Weeks 11~12: An Introduction to Information Theory
Weeks 13~14: Block and Convolutional Channel Codes 
Week     15: Adjusted holiday (Dragon Boat Festival)
Week     16: Spread Spectrum Signals for Digital Communications
Week     17: Final Exam
Week     18: Spread Spectrum Signals for Digital Communications

The schedule may be adjusted if necessary.
scorePolicy:
Prerequisites: Probability, Signal and Systems (preferred but not required), Principles of Communications (preferred but not required)

Matlab Assignment 30%
Midterm Exam      35%
Final Exam        35%
materials: John Proakis and Massoud Salehi, Digital Communications, 5th ed., McGraw-Hill, 2008.
